intro: Cryptosepalum exfoliatum subsp. suffruticans, commonly known as the hairy cryptosepalum, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the Rubiaceae family. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rounded or ovate shape. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
